author: striker
msg: * INSTALL
(III.A.1): Correct the cvs command to retrieve the HEAD of httpd-2.0.  The
previous instructions would lead to retrieval of httpd-2.1.
(III.C): Add a note about ordering of LoadModule directives in httpd.conf.

author: ghudson
msg: Clean up ra_svn error handling as it pertains to reporters and editors
and command loops.  Pipeline reporter operations.  (Still to do: clean
up error handling of get-file and apply-textdelta; pipeline
change-dir-prop and change-file-prop.)
This is a mondo incompatible protocol change.
* include/svn_repos.h
(svn_repos_finish_report): Document that the caller has the
responsibility for aborting the edit if there is an error, if
anyone is going to do so.
* libsvn_ra_svn/protocol:
(commit): Note that we only get commit info on successful edit.
(update, switch, status, diff): Delay response until after report
and edit, so that the client can find out about reporter or editor
errors.
(log): Document that a log-entry can be the word "done".  Document
that the response is delayed until the end (as of rev 5371).
(set-path, delete-path, link-path, finish-report, abort-report):
Pipeline, by eliminating the command responses.  Errors will be
reported in the command response of the command which invokes the
report.
* include/svn_ra_svn.h, libsvn_ra_svn/editor.c, libsvn_ra_svn/marshal.c
(svn_ra_svn_handle_commands, svn_ra_svn_drive_editor): Eliminate
pass_through_errors.  It's no longer needed now that we can report
server->client editing errors back to the client.f
* libsvn_ra_svn/client.c
(ra_svn_set_path, ra_svn_delete_path, ra_svn_link_path,
ra_svn_abort_report): For pipelining, don't read a response.  For
now, we still have to flush on each report operation because of the
double-flushing conundrum presented by APR pipe objects.
(ra_svn_finish_report): Read a command response after driving the
editor; this is where we find out errors resulting from reporter or
editor operations.
(ra_svn_update, ra_svn_switch, ra_svn_status, ra_svn_diff): Delay
command response until after report and edit operations.  We also
have to flush here because of the double-flushing problem.
* svnserve/serve.c
(report_driver_baton_t): Add a new field "err" to record failures
resulting from reporter or editor operations.
(set_path, delete_path, link_path, finish_report, abort_report):
Remove command responses, for pipelining.
(handle_report): Removed in favor of accept_report.
(accept_report): New function to implement the back half of
update/switch/status/diff.  Accept a report, drive an editor, and
write out a command response or return a command error.
(commit): If a client edit command results in an error, don't pass
it through; wait for the client to abort the edit or abandon the
connection.  If the client aborts the edit, don't try to report
commit info.
(update, switch_cmd, status, diff): Use new accept_report function
to implement the back half.
(serve): Fix up call site of svn_ra_svn_handle_commands.

author: ghudson
msg: Make it easier (though not trivial) to run just one kind of test.
* Makefile.in
(TESTS): New variable combinng $(TEST_PROGRAMS) and
@FS_TEST_PROGRAMS@, so that they can both be overridden at once.
(check): Document TESTS and CLEANUP variables in comments.

author: ghudson
msg: * libsvn_ra_svn/marshal.c (svn_ra_svn_handle_commands): Style police.

author: brane
msg: Get "make install" working on Cygwin.
Patch by: Max Bowsher <maxb@ukf.net>
* Makefile.in (EXEEXT): New make variable set by configure.
* configure.in: AC_SUBST(EXEEXT).
* build/generator/gen_make.py (_extension_map): For programs, allow
configure to detect the correct extension.
